{"title":"page 17","subjec":{},"descri":{},"creato":{},"publis":{},"date":{},"year":{},"format":{},"reposi":{},"collec":{},"reposa":{},"rights":{},"digitb":{},"langua":{},"topics":{},"cite":{},"notes":{},"notesa":{},"source":{},"box":{},"folder":{},"identi":{},"relati":{},"findin":{},"catalo":{},"type":{},"full":"RULES AND REGULATIONS
PARTICULAR GOVERNMENT
EACH MEMBER OF THE DEPARTMENT.
ARTICLE II.
CHIEF OF POLICE.
Section 1. It will be the duty of the Chief of
Police to repair to the scenes of fires, riots and
tumultuous assemblages, and take charge of the
Police present; and use any exertion to save and
protect property, disperse mobs, and arrest, or
cause to be arrested, such persons as he may find
engaged in disturbing the peace, or who may aid
or abet other^So to do.
Sec. 2. He shall have power, under the Mayor,
to direct any or all of the members of the Police
force to any place where their services may be
deemed necessary.
Sec. 3. He shall inspect each Police Station","fullrs":{},"find":"2656.jp2","dmaccess":{},"dmimage":{},"dmcreated":"2012-01-18","dmmodified":"2012-01-18","dmoclcno":{},"dmrecord":"2655","restrictionCode":"1","cdmfilesize":"511718","cdmfilesizeformatted":"0.49 MB","cdmprintpdf":"0","cdmhasocr":"1","cdmisnewspaper":"0"}
